definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: Mercy falls like the gentle rain from the sky upon the earth.
sentences.chinese: 寬恕像一場從空中降到地面的及時雨。

sentences.english: Pamela told me to sprinkle shouts, timely rain.
sentences.chinese: 向我灑來甘美的喊叫，及時雨。

sentences.english: This timely rain saved farmers the trouble of irrigating the fields.
sentences.chinese: 這場及時雨省了農民澆地的麻煩。

sentences.english: Safety more timely rain, less education an afterthought.
sentences.chinese: 安全多下及時雨，教育少放馬後炮。

sentences.english: The timely rain revived the droughtstricken crops.
sentences.chinese: 這場及時雨使受旱的禾苗都緩過來了。

sentences.english: The shower last night hit the nail on the head. The plants were nearly parched.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚下了一場及時雨，植物都快乾死了。
幸好隨後下了一場及時雨。

sentences.english: The timely rain after a long time of drought will certainly bring on the crops.
sentences.chinese: 久旱之後的這場及時雨肯定會有助於農作物的生長。

sentences.english: Since we were experiencing a drought on the island, the rain was a welcome relief.
sentences.chinese: 島上正值乾旱，所以這場及時雨使旱情得到了緩解。

definition: to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to force someone to do something
see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
to charge and break through enemy lines
Zhou Ji (1781-1839), Qing writer and poet
help to the needy/emergency relief/charity/to give to poorer relative/(also 賙濟|赒济)
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
variant of 獨角戲|独角戏[du2 jiao3 xi4]
